meanings.definition: A machine used for pressing clothes or linens with heat and pressure.
meanings.sent1: The hotpress smoothed out the wrinkles in the shirt.
meanings.sent2: She used the hotpress to iron her favorite dress.
meanings.sent3: The hotpress was so eager to flatten the fabric, it hummed with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The hotpress worked its magic, transforming the crumpled cloth into a neat garment.
meanings.sent5: The hotpress hissed as it worked, leaving behind perfectly pressed clothes.

meanings.definition: To press or iron clothes or linens using a hotpress.
meanings.sent1: Mom will hotpress my school uniform before the big event.
meanings.sent2: I need to hotpress my shirt for the job interview.
meanings.sent3: He hotpressed his pants so well, they looked like they came straight from the store.
meanings.sent4: She hotpressed the tablecloth, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent5: The tailor hotpresses each garment with care, ensuring a crisp finish.

meanings.definition: A method of printmaking in which a plate is heated before applying ink.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a hotpress to create unique prints.
meanings.sent2: The hotpress technique results in vibrant artwork.
meanings.sent3: The hotpress in the studio was always in high demand among artists.
meanings.sent4: The hotpress added depth and richness to the print.
meanings.sent5: Using a hotpress requires skill and precision to achieve the desired effect.
